titleStmt.title: By the Lords-Justices and Council, a proclamation. Charles Porter, Coningesby. Forasmuch as we are certainly informed from several parts of the kingdom, that the french privateers which do infest the southern and western coasts of this kingdom have frequently received intelligence ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King and Queen's most Excellent Majesties on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
"Given at the Council-Chamber in Dublin, the 20th. day of May, 1692.".
Concerning fishing boats from the South.--Steele.
Steele notation: Arms 201. from surprize shall.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
